#Text=Wikinews Shorts : December 2 , 2008
#Text=A compilation of brief news reports for Tuesday , December 2 , 2008 .
#Text=Contribute to Wikinews by expanding these briefs or add a new one .
#Text=Brazil announces plan to curb deforestation
#Text=Brazil announced a plan to slow deforestation rates in the Amazon Rainforest by seventy percent over the next ten years .
#Text=This comes after a call for international funding to stop further deforestation of the rainforest .
#Text=The plan will aim to reduce the clearing of the Amazon , which is the world 's largest rainforest , to 5,850 square kilometres by 2018 , half of the current rate .
#Text=This year , the deforestation rate went up after falling for the last four years .
#Text=Sources
#Text=" Brazil pledges to cut Amazon destruction in half " — stv . tv , December 2 , 2008
#Text=" 70 % deforestation cuts for Brazil " — BBC News Online , December 1 , 2008

column1: #Text=Pound sterling plunges against US dollar
#Text=The British pound sterling was down 5.2 cents to US$ 1.486 , its biggest single-day percentage point fall since the United Kingdom left the Exchange Rate Mechanism ( ERM ) in 1992 .
#Text=The pound was also three and a half cents lower against the euro , at 0.851 pounds .
#Text=The FTSE 100 index fell 5.2 % on Monday , further exacerbating problems .
#Text=Sources
#Text=" Sterling plunges against dollar " — BBC News Online , December 1 , 2008
#Text=" Pound battered by fears of prolonged recession " — Times Online , December 1 , 2008
#Text=Unpaid Zimbabwean soldiers run amok in Harare
#Text=Soldiers in Zimbabwe got fed up after waiting in line at a bank in the capital of Harare .
#Text=Due to rampant hyperinflation ( the latest count has reached 231,000,000 % annually ) , banks often have a shortage of cash and what they have is rationed out .
#Text=Often the amount that is permitted to be withdrawn cannot even pay for a loaf of bread at the street markets .
#Text=After waiting all day in line at the bank , the soldiers and other customers attacked money changers and stole cash .
#Text=Initially , city police stood by , but eventually broke up the rampage with tear gas .
#Text=Sources
#Text=" Soldiers rampage at Harare bank " — BBC News Online , December 1 , 2008
#Text=" Zimbabwe soldiers attack money changers in capital " — Fox News Channel , December 1 , 2008
#Text=Dow drops 680 points
#Text=In the United States , the Dow Jones Industrial Average lost 679.95 points ( 7.70 % ) Monday , its fourth worst drop in history , to close at 8,149.09 .
#Text=The drop marked the end of a five-day rally that began last week .
#Text=According to Chuck Widger of Brinker Capital , " this is just another episode in a long story and the story is all about recession and the question is how long and how deep .
#Text=Charles Mikolajczak .
#Text=" US STOCKS-Dow loses 679.95 as economy , Bernanke revive fear " — guardian.co.uk , December 1 , 2008
#Text=Election in Romania expected to lead to intense negotiations
#Text=The legislative election in Romania has left the Democratic Liberal Party ( PD-L ) and the Social Democratic Party ( PSD ) separated by less than one percent after all votes were counted .
#Text=The Central Electoral Office says SPD won about 33.6 percent of the vote and PD-L got just under 33 percent .
#Text=The National Liberal Party ( PNL ) was third with 18.6 percent .
#Text=All votes have been counted but the official results are not expected until the end of next week .
#Text=Analysts expect both SPD and PD-L to seek the support of PNL to form a coalition government .
#Text=Current Prime Minister Călin Popescu-Tăriceanu is a member of PNL .
#Text=Meanwhile , President Traian Băsescu , who has no official party association , is known to support PD-L .
#Text=The President is not required to nominate a Prime Minister from the winning party .
#Text=Sources
#Text=" Tough coalition talks in Romania " — BBC News Online , December 2 , 2008
